parameters.content:
### ‚öôÔ∏è Setup Instructions

1. **Import Workflow**: 
Load this workflow into your n8n instance

2. **Configure Authentication**: 
Set up oauth2 credentials

3. **Activate Workflow**:
Enable the workflow to start the MCP server

4. **Get MCP URL**: 
Copy the webhook URL from the MCP trigger

5. **Connect AI Agent**:
Use the MCP URL in your AI agent configuration


### üí° Usage Notes
‚Ä¢ Parameters are auto-populated by AI using $fromAI() expressions
‚Ä¢ With 18 API endpoints available as tools
‚Ä¢ Responses maintain original API structure


### üõ†Ô∏è Customization
‚Ä¢ Add data transformation nodes if needed
‚Ä¢ Implement custom error handling
‚Ä¢ Add logging or monitoring nodes

‚Ä¢ Modify parameter defaults in any HTTP request node as needed

### üí¨ Need Help?
Ping me on [discord](https://discord.me/cfomodz) for integration guidance and custom automations. Check the [n8n documentation](https://docs.n8n.io/integrations/builtin/cluster-nodes/sub-nodes/n8n-nodes-langchain.toolmcp/) for more information.

## üõ†Ô∏è Bufferapp MCP Server ‚úÖ 18 operations

### About
Social media management for marketers and agencies

### üîß How it Works

This workflow converts the Bufferapp API into an MCP-compatible interface for AI agents.

‚Ä¢ **MCP Trigger**: Serves as your server endpoint for AI agent requests
‚Ä¢ **HTTP Request Nodes**: Handle API calls to https://api.bufferapp.com/1/
‚Ä¢ **AI Expressions**: Automatically populate parameters via `$fromAI()` placeholders
‚Ä¢ **Native Integration**: Returns responses directly to the AI agent


### üìã Available Operations (18 endpoints)

**Info (1 operations)**
Get Buffer Configuration

**Links (1 operations)**
Get Link Share Count

**Profiles (7 operations)**
Update Profile Schedules, Get Profile Schedules, Get Pending Updates, Reorder Profile Updates, Get Sent Updates, Shuffle Profile Updates, Get Profile Details

**Profiles Media Type Extension (1 operations)**
List User Profiles

**Updates (7 operations)**
Create Status Updates, Delete Status Update, Get Update Interactions, Move Update to Top, Share Update Immediately, Edit Status Update, Get Status Update

**User Media Type Extension (1 operations)**
Get User Details

parameters.toolDescription:
With the current configuration that Buffer is using, including supported services, their icons and the varying limits of character and schedules.

Parameters:
- Path parameters:
  ‚Ä¢ mediaTypeExtension (required)

parameters.name: url
parameters.value: ={{ $fromAI('url', 'URL-encoded URL of the page for which the number of shares is requested.', 'string') }}

parameters.toolDescription:
Numbers of shares a link has had using Buffer.

Parameters:
- Path parameters:
  ‚Ä¢ mediaTypeExtension (required)
- Query parameters:
  ‚Ä¢ url (required) - URL-encoded URL of the page for which the number of shares is requested.

parameters.name: count
parameters.value: ={{ $fromAI('count', 'Specifies the number of status updates to receive. If provided, must be between 1 and 100.', 'number') }}

parameters.name: utc

parameters.toolDescription:
"Returns an array of updates that are currently in the buffer for an individual social media profile.

Parameters:
- Path parameters:
  ‚Ä¢ id (required)
  ‚Ä¢ mediaTypeExtension (required)
- Query parameters:
  ‚Ä¢ page (optional) - Specifies the page of status updates to receive. If not specified the first page of results will be returned.
  ‚Ä¢ count (optional) - Specifies the number of status updates to receive. If provided, must be between 1 and 100.
  ‚Ä¢ since (optional) - Specifies a unix timestamp which only status updates created after this time will be retrieved.
  ‚Ä¢ utc (optional) - If utc is set times will be returned relative to UTC rather than the users associated timezone.

Edit the order at which statuses for the specified social media profile will be sent out of the buffer.

Parameters:
- Path parameters:
  ‚Ä¢ id (required)
  ‚Ä¢ mediaTypeExtension (required)

parameters.value: ={{ $fromAI('page', 'Specifies the page of status updates to receive. If not specified the first page of results will be returned.', 'number') }}

parameters.toolDescription:
Array of updates that have been sent from the buffer for an individual social media profile.

Parameters:
- Path parameters:
  ‚Ä¢ id (required)
  ‚Ä¢ mediaTypeExtension (required)
- Query parameters:
  ‚Ä¢ page (optional) - Specifies the page of status updates to receive. If not specified the first page of results will be returned.
  ‚Ä¢ count (optional) - Specifies the number of status updates to receive. If provided, must be between 1 and 100.
  ‚Ä¢ since (optional) - Specifies a unix timestamp which only status updates created after this time will be retrieved.
  ‚Ä¢ utc (optional) - If utc is set times will be returned relative to UTC rather than the users associated timezone.

Randomize the order at which statuses for the specified social media profile will be sent out of the buffer.

Parameters:
- Path parameters:
  ‚Ä¢ id (required)
  ‚Ä¢ mediaTypeExtension (required)

Details of the single specified social media profile.

Parameters:
- Path parameters:
  ‚Ä¢ mediaTypeExtension (required)
  ‚Ä¢ id (required)

Array of social media profiles connected to a users account.

Parameters:
- Path parameters:
  ‚Ä¢ mediaTypeExtension (required)

Create one or more new status updates.

Parameters:
- Path parameters:
  ‚Ä¢ mediaTypeExtension (required)

Permanently delete an existing status update.

Parameters:
- Path parameters:
  ‚Ä¢ id (required)
  ‚Ä¢ mediaTypeExtension (required)

parameters.name: event

Plurality has no effect other than visual semantics. See /info/configuration for more information on supported interaction events.', 'string') }}

parameters.toolDescription:
Detailed information on individual interactions with the social media update such as favorites, retweets and likes.

Parameters:
- Path parameters:
  ‚Ä¢ id (required)
  ‚Ä¢ mediaTypeExtension (required)
- Query parameters:
  ‚Ä¢ event (required) - Specifies a type of event to be retrieved, for example "retweet", "like", "comment", "mention" or "reshare". They can also be plural (e.g., "reshares"). Plurality has no effect other than visual semantics. See /info/configuration for more information on supported interaction events.
  ‚Ä¢ page (optional) - Specifies the page of status updates to receive. If not specified the first page of results will be returned.
  ‚Ä¢ count (optional) - Specifies the number of status updates to receive. If provided, must be between 1 and 100.

Move an existing status update to the top of the queue and recalculate times for all updates in the queue. Returns the update with its new posting time.

Parameters:
- Path parameters:
  ‚Ä¢ id (required)
  ‚Ä¢ mediaTypeExtension (required)

Immediately shares a single pending update and recalculates times for updates remaining in the queue.

Parameters:
- Path parameters:
  ‚Ä¢ id (required)
  ‚Ä¢ mediaTypeExtension (required)
